AN 1110 Introduction to Animated Storytelling Online
Where Your Creativity Comes To Life
ROCKY MOUNTAIN COLLEGE OF ART   DESIGN
We believe in originality. Creativity happens outside the lines. And passion, talent, and groundbreaking innovation live inside these walls. Welcome to RMCAD.

At RMCAD, you’ll be taught by real artists, designers, and liberal arts professionals who have lived and worked in their respective industries. Are you ready to explore your creativity with plenty of room to grow? You’ll find it here. You’ll learn to transform your talent into a career that fuels your passion.
With both on-campus and online programs, we balance real-world connections and hands-on learning with the high-tech resources and accessibility you expect in a digital world.
FOR TODAY. FOR TOMORROW. FOR LIFE . YOU BELONG HERE.

You know that voice in the back of your mind? The one that’s always told you to follow your dreams? This is the place that makes that dream a reality. Spend the next chapter of your life being challenged, taking risks, and embracing beauty.

When you’re bursting with drive, determination, and creativity, it’s hard to sit still and fade into the background. See what our students are up to and get in the know on upcoming (and unforgettable) events.
FabLab Workshop: Using the Laser Cutter
Workshop Series: Building A Professional Portfolio
FabLab Workshop: Introduction to Vinyl Cutting
I design for the powerful woman who wears garments with more coverage to inspire her.
My only advice is: be confident and no matter what mistakes you made just keep going and you will go through it.
This is my final hoorah so it’s very important that this kind of shows who I am as a designer and what my aesthetic and who I am most importantly.
What makes me proud to be a RMCAD graduate is the fact that I’ve been challenged so incredibly much here and that it’s actually been applicable outside of RMCAD.
I’m proud to be a RMCAD graduate because there’s so many amazing staff here. They support you, challenge you and really push you to get where you need to be.
RMCAD gave me the space to experiment. All of the instructors I had let me take not only what I wanted but what I needed from the class I was in.
Ten years later I’ve developed a skill from my professor’s random act of kindness. That little bottle was the start of me dripping paint.

RMCAD was really influential for me, the teachers I had were extremely impactful and I still keep in touch with them. I think a smaller school like RMCAD can be really beneficial in terms of making connections and keeping those connections.

Please fill out the following form to apply for admission to Rocky Mountain College of Art   Design.
Note that there is a $50 non-refundable application fee.
Date Format: MM slash DD slash YYYY
I am a Veteran or the dependent of a Veteran
If you are a citizen or permanent resident of a place other than that listed in your contact information, please tell us where you are from. Include State/Province and Country.
This information is voluntary and confidential. It is used to help the college understand our student population, and will not be used to make admissions or financial aid decisions.

Have you ever been convicted of a crime, made a plea of guilty, accepted a deferred judgement, been adjudicated, or been required to register as a sex offender? Misdemeanor traffic offenses are exempt.
The admissions application process for students with disabilities is the same as that of other students. Disclosure of your disability is optional and voluntary.
Will you need reasonable academic accommodations or adjustments while attending RMCAD?

It is advisable to send documentation directly to Student Disability Services (SDS). Your eligibility for services/accommodations from SDS is a separate process and is done independently of the Office of Admissions.
For additional information SDS can be reached via email at
Please select the modality/program for which you would like to apply:
Interior Design Online - Sustainable Design Specialization
Going to college for the first time
Transferring from another school, or going back to college
Returning to RMCAD after taking a break
Interested in auditing/attending classes, but not attaining a degree
Date High School/GED Diploma Was Received
If you are still in high school please list your current cumulative GPA. Note that official transcripts must be submitted for admission. If you do not know your GPA please type "NA"
Did you complete any AP, IB or CLEP courses during high school?
Yes, I will require student housing.
No, I will not require student housing.
How do you plan on paying for your education?
YES, I would like to be considered for additional scholarships and grants.
What other schools are you considering?
Know a friend who might be interested in RMCAD? Tell us about them:
Please include a name and phone/email.
In order to process your application and $50 fee, please enter your credit card information below.
Have you made deferment arrangements with your admissions counselor?
Please select yes if you are a military veteran/dependent or have a fee waiver and will be providing documentation from your high school counselor.

I confirm that all the information listed above is true to the best of my knowledge.   I understand that RMCAD will contact me via phone, social media, text and/or email to help me complete my application for admission including financial aid information. I agree to return all correspondence in a timely manner in order to expedient my application process. I also understand RMCAD occasionally records phone conversations for training purposes and consent.  I agree to adhere to any admissions and financial aid deadlines as set by my Admissions Counselor and/or my Enrollment Guide and as reflected in my Achieve Portal.
I have read and agree to the above terms and conditions
I would like to receive text messages
I would like to receive information from RMCAD
